bibl.title: Chung Him and Seid Yam v. Henry M. White. Letter of Transmittal
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: Inspector in Charge, Immigration Service, Ketchikan, Alaska.

The Bureau refers to your letter of May 17th, No. 528, with inclosure, and transmits herewith formal warrants of arrest issued today in the case of the aliens Belle Brown, Rose Burke, Nina Miller, alias Peggy Miller, Margherita Tarabolo, alias Adeline Berger, Sam Guem, Chung Him, Seid Yam, and Gin Kato.
Alien prostitutes in Restricted District, Ketchikan, Alaska, May 15, 1920.
House #1. BELLE BROWN: Age 30; born in Belgium; landed in New York 18 years ago, destined to brother, Jake Brown, Cleveland, O. never married; subject of Belgium.
House #3. ROSE BURKE: Russian Jewess; born in Russia, came to U.S. 13 years ago; never married.

House #9. NINA MILLER, alias PEGGY MILLER; Age 26; subject of Italy; born in Rome Italy; in London; came from England Miller; landing at Halifax; remained in Canada until 1915 when she entered U.S. via CPR from Vancouver to Seattle.

House #11. ADELINE BERGER, correct name MARGHERITA TARABOLO, subject of Italy; claims first came to U.S. in 19 last entry March 25, 1919, via New York ss "La Touri " under name of Margherita Tarabolo.
Aliens employed in Houses of Prostitution, Ketchikan, Alaska, 5-15-1920
House #21. SAM GUEM: employed as cook; Chinaman; born in China; first came to U.S. during registration period of Chinese; returned to China for a year's visit about 1915.

House #31. CHUNG HIM; employed as cook; Chinaman; born in China; claims in US 26 years and that certificate of residence is in Portland; made trip to China 4 years ago. Has worked in this house of prostitution last 2 1/2 months.
House #7A SEID YAM: employed as cook; age 57; claims certificate of residence is in Portland; made trip to China 9 years ago.
House #9-B GIN KATO; Japanese; employed as cook; claims in US 40 years; never returned to Japan.
